dcterms:creator: D. Landgrebe
dcterms:description: The Indian Pines dataset was captured in 1992 by the Airborne Visible/Infrared Imaging Spectrometer (AVIRIS) sensor in Northwestern Indiana, USA, which is mainly composed of multiple agricultural fields. The spatial size of this dataset is 145×145 pixels with a spatial resolution of 20 meters per pixel (mpp), and there are 224 spectral bands in the wavelength range from 0.4 to 2.5 µm. After removing the background pixels, 10249 pixels are reserved, which contain useful ground-truth information from 16 different class labels.
dcterms:title: Indian Pines

dcterms:creator: J. M. Bioucas-Dias
A. Plaza
G. Camps-Valls
P. Scheunders
N. Nasrabadi
J. Chanussot
dcterms:description: The Salinas Valley dataset was collected by the 224-band AVIRIS sensor over Salinas Valley, California. This dataset is made up of 512 lines and 217 columns, and contains 16 ground-truth classes. After removing the water absorption bands and noise-affected bands, there are 204 spectral bands preserved.
dcterms:title: Salinas Valley

dcterms:creator: G. Camps-Valls
D. Tuia
L. Bruzzone
J. A. Benediktsson
dcterms:description: The University of Pavia dataset was acquired by the Reflective Optics System Imaging Spectrometer (ROSIS) sensor over University of Pavia, Northern Italy. There are 103 spectral bands in the spectral range from 0.43 to 0.86 µm by removing several noise-corrupted bands, and it presents a size of 610 × 340 pixels with a spatial resolution of 1.3 mpp. This dataset contains 9 distinguishable classes.
dcterms:title: University of Pavia
